intro: Barleria prionitis var. diacantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged oppositely along the stem. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically blue or purple in color, arranged in dense spikes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
